channel.title: Al Gore, Nobel Prize for Peace
channel.description:
Al Gore and the U.N.'s Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change won the 2007 Nobel Peace Prize Friday, and the former vice president used the attention to warn that global warming is "the greatest challenge we've ever faced." World leaders, President Bush among them, congratulated the winners, while skeptics of man's contribution to warming criticized the choice of Gore.
He deserves it :o Wish he ran for president again D: [i]Source:[/i] Erm.. The Today show D: http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/21262661/

item.title: Al Gore, Nobel Prize for Peace
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

exe626:

Yeah… Then we would be wiping our asses with 2 sheets of ass paper. We’d be using corn as fuel for our cars and be forced to play Car pool because of how high he would have regular gas prices raised.

Yea, and our earth wouldn’t be in the shitload of shit we’re in now. I’d rather have gas prices high and people finding alternative sources of energy than artificiallly low gas prices that encourage waste. Necessity breeds invention. We need to increase water prices also, especially in the south west. The Colorado River is being sucked dry, and it’s not helping the world. The however many trillion dollars Bush wasted could have been put to better use. Like solving world hunger.

Read full topic

item.title: Al Gore, Nobel Prize for Peace
item.dc:creator: @Chimaera_God Chimaera God
item.description:
@Chimaera_God wrote:

Buzzy:

Al Gore is probably one of the coolest guys in politics. He gets disrespected by America, by not being put in office, and then doesn’t give a rats ass, and still goes out and makes a great name for himself by educating the world about Global Warming, plus, he won the Nobel Peace Prize. Show me someone besides Andrew Jackson in politics, alive or dead.

I agree with you on that Buzzy. Al Gore should have been our president back in 2001, but Bush’s brother Jebediah gave him Florida’s vote :mad:.
Oh yeah, all of you people who says tht global warming isn’t important at the moment are just ignorant. If you guys have seen Al’s movie "An Inconvienient Truth would know that the Earth’s temperature has gone up more than one degree in the last century. Some places, like Alaska for instance, have had a temperature rise of over five degrees in the last thirty years.

Read full topic
